entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: Twenty years later. A wandering drummer arrives at the ruins of a once-prosperous estate.

entries.speaker: Dom
entries.text: This place... something draws me here. The drum feels heavier. There are spirits in these walls.

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: Use the Spirit Pulse [SPACE] to reveal hidden echoes of the past. The drum connects to what lies beneath.

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: A sound... like a child weeping. The spirit pulse reveals a shimmering figure near the nahor tree.

entries.speaker: Tejimola Spirit
entries.text: Help me... please...

entries.speaker: Dom
entries.text: [Drum response - no words, but understanding]

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: The spirit is trapped, its memories scattered like broken pottery. To free her, you must recover what was lost.

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: A dry well stands in the courtyard. Once, it held a secret...

entries.speaker: Dom
entries.text: The spirit pulse shows something... a memory hidden below. Tejimola's father showed her a secret spot down here.

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: [Split screen activates - Past: Tejimola and father at the well / Present: Dom examining the dry well]

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: On the floorboards of a ruined room, something glints. A golden hairpin, tarnished by time.

entries.speaker: Dom
entries.text: This belonged to her. I can feel the love in it. A father's gift...

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: The spirit grows stronger with each memory recovered. The nahor tree seems to respond...

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: In the child's room, echoes of a lullaby. The walls remember the melody.

entries.speaker: Dom
entries.text: A song... I can play it on the drum. Let me match the melody the walls remember.

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: Near the riverside, the rotting hull of a small boat. Once it carried a family on golden afternoons.

entries.speaker: Dom
entries.text: The river still carries her voice. Let me listen...

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: Beneath the great nahor tree, buried among its roots, a seed case holds the final memory.

entries.speaker: Dom
entries.text: This is where she rests. This is where it all began... and where it must end.

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: All five memories recovered. The nahor tree pulses with light. But a darkness stirs...

entries.speaker: Tejimola Spirit
entries.text: I remember now... I remember everything. But she is still here. The cruelty lives on.
entries.textAssamese: মই এতিয়া মনত পেলাইছোঁ... মই সকলো মনত পেলাইছোঁ।

entries.speaker: Dom
entries.text: Then we face her together. My drum and your spirit. We end this.
